subject: Sales
title: Reading Body Language
description: A quick, practical guide to Reading Body Language.

hook.text: The buyer says yes, but arms are crossed and eyes won't meet yours. Something is very wrong.

buildup.text: Over half of communication is nonverbal. The body often tells a story the mouth contradicts.

discovery.text: Leaning in signals interest. Leaning back signals resistance. Touching the face often means doubt.

twist.text: But body language is culturally loaded. Crossed arms might mean cold, not closed off.

climax.text: Read clusters, not single gestures. When three signals align, the body is telling the truth.

punchline.text: Watch the body. It's more honest than the mouth.

quiz.question: How should you read body language in negotiation?
options: Focus on one gesture at a time
Look for clusters of signals that align
